intro: Cacalia pratensis, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from June to August. Cacalia pratensis is often found in habitats with partial shade and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
